intro: Ryparosa wrayi, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Ryparosa wrayi is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its bright, long-lasting blooms.
